page.title: 10DOCTOR'S AFTERNOON & EVENING
page.content: 1500 Driving medical examination. From 1545 to 1800 surgery with 16 consulations. Letters were dictated and other paper work completed before visiting a child with middle ear infection. At 1900 'bleeped'. A teenager had taken an overdose and emergency action necessary.- referred to West Suffolk Hospital Casualty Department.At 1920 arrived home and had supper.2130 emergency call to a man with cerebral haemorrhage. 2300 another emergency call, this time a child with meningitis who was transferred to the local Paediatric ward.2350 arrived home to a welcome bed and hopefully some sleep, but who knows - the phone may ring at anytime!
